author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content:
Would it be plausible to introduce a 'maturation delay' to block rewards quite a while before the merge, and have it's duration increase over time (so when the merge date is proximate the delay will be quite long). 

In Bitcoin, a miner cannot spend their block rewards for 100 blocks (https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/questions/1991/what-is-the-block-maturation-time). 

This seems like it would only protect against existential threats, since miner expectations that ETH prices would recover long term would leave them no worse off for attacking. 

A downside is that it would affect miner cashflows and decrease security leading up to the merge (with rewards still going to be paid out eventually).

author: m.kalinin
content: It's been discussed a while ago in this thread. This mechanism can be gamed by selling block rewards before they become spendable, i.e. before the merge.
